question_text: When is the new intern starting?

choices.text: She's already here.
I'm not sure where it is.
We'll turn it on later.

explanation: La question porte sur le temps ('When'). La réponse (A) indique que la personne est déjà présente. (C) est un piège phonétique sur 'intern'/'turn'.

question_text: Isn't the Art Center open on Mondays?

choices.text: It usually is, but they're setting up a special exhibition this week.
Yes, the registration fee covers all art supplies.
No, I sent her the artwork on Tuesday.

explanation: La question porte sur les horaires d'ouverture. La réponse (A) confirme l'habitude ('usually is') tout en expliquant l'exception actuelle. (C) est un piège phonétique entre 'Art Center' et 'sent her'.

question_text: Who will go with you on the business trip?

choices.text: By train.
The Lindholt Hotel.
Ms. Fisher.

explanation: La question demande une personne ('Who'). La réponse (C) donne un nom (Ms. Fisher). (A) répond au moyen de transport et (B) au lieu d'hébergement.

question_text: When does the train leave?

choices.text: To New York.
In ten minutes.
It's training.

explanation: La question porte sur l'horaire ('When'). La réponse (B) indique un délai. (C) piège phonétique ('Train'/'Training').

question_text: May I have this prescription filled please?

choices.text: I'm sorry, there's no more room.
I'll need to order this, you can pick it up this afternoon.
It certainly is very filling.

explanation: Contexte de pharmacie ('prescription filled'). La réponse (B) est cohérente (commande et retrait). (A) et (C) jouent sur les autres sens de 'fill'.

question_text: Haven't you heard about the CEO?

choices.text: No, what happened to him?
Yes, I bought it yesterday.
Your wife is on the phone.

explanation: Demande de nouvelles. La réponse (A) est logique. (B) utilise 'it' (objet) au lieu de 'him' (personne).

question_text: When was the train supposed to arrive?

choices.text: No, not until 5:30.
I didn't bring an umbrella today.
Half an hour ago.

explanation: Horaire passé ('When was'). La réponse (C) indique un moment passé ('ago'). (B) piège phonétique ('Train'/'Rain').

question_text: I wonder if anyone would like to go out for a drink this evening.

choices.text: It's a wonder they're here.
Nobody won this afternoon.
We'd love to.

explanation: Invitation. La réponse (C) 'We'd love to' est la formule pour accepter. (B) piège phonétique ('One'/'Won').

question_text: Where are you going for vacation?

choices.text: I'm moving to a new apartment.
We're going to the beach.
I loaned my sunglasses to George.

explanation: Question de destination ('Where'). La réponse (B) cite un lieu de vacances.

question_text: Where did you spend the weekend?

choices.text: A lot of money.
We went to the seaside.
Two days.

explanation: Question de lieu ('Where'). La réponse (B) indique un endroit. (A) est un piège sur le sens de 'spend' (argent vs temps).

question_text: Would you like a window or an aisle seat?

choices.text: I'll get one for both of us.
A table for four, please.
Either is fine with me.

explanation: Choix de place. La réponse (C) indique une indifférence ('Either is fine'). (B) concerne un restaurant.

question_text: Where did Elaine write down her password?

choices.text: Right before she went on vacation.
No, you should turn left down Harold Pass.
It's on a note on her computer.

explanation: Question de lieu ('Where'). La réponse (C) indique l'endroit. (A) joue sur 'Write'/'Right' et (B) sur 'Pass'/'Password'.

question_text: Where should I put these lab materials when I finished using them?

choices.text: I've had them since last week.
You can get them from any supervisor.
Take them to Dr. Rossi's office.

explanation: Instruction de rangement ('Where put'). La réponse (C) donne la destination. (B) indique la source.

question_text: What do you think, plain or patterned carpet in the waiting room?

choices.text: Not much longer, I hope.
There’s no room on the plane.
Either one is fine with me.

explanation: Demande d'avis sur un choix. La réponse (C) exprime l'absence de préférence. (B) joue sur 'plain'/'plane'.

question_text: Where do you keep the bread?

choices.text: I'm worried that my car will break down.
In the corner, next to the vegetables.
No, it is purple.

explanation: Question de lieu ('Where'). La réponse (B) indique l'emplacement. (A) piège phonétique 'Bread'/'Break'.

question_text: When will I receive your company’s prospectus?

choices.text: I would prefer to go alone.
Marie views this problem differently than I do.
In two to three weeks.

explanation: Question de délai ('When'). La réponse (C) donne un temps futur.

question_text: Could you put that on my bill, please?

choices.text: Certainly, if you'd just sign the check.
Actually, I built it myself.
I'm sorry but Bill is not on duty today.

explanation: Demande d'ajout à la note. La réponse (A) accepte. (B) joue sur 'bill'/'built' et (C) sur le prénom Bill.

question_text: How much is this coupon worth?

choices.text: It expires on May 31st.
Fifty cents.
That store doesn’t sell batteries.

explanation: Question de valeur ('How much worth'). La réponse (B) donne un montant.

question_text: Your managing director resigned yesterday, didn't he?

choices.text: Yes, it was quite a surprise.
The letter is ready for you to sign.
Yes, I can give you directions.

explanation: Confirmation de démission. La réponse (A) confirme et commente. (B) joue sur 'Resigned'/'Sign' et (C) sur 'Director'/'Directions'.

question_text: Have you seen the plans for the new office building yet?

choices.text: No, I’m meeting with the architect on Thursday.
No, I don’t subscribe to cable television.
No, I need to contact my travel agent.

explanation: Question sur les plans. La réponse (A) est logique (rencontre avec l'architecte). (C) évoque des plans de voyage.

question_text: Don’t you think there are too many commercials on TV?

choices.text: I think she’s coming in at the other station.
Definitely, I’m always changing channels.
Yes, both men work in television advertising.

explanation: Opinion sur les publicités. La réponse (B) confirme l'agacement.

question_text: Have you heard the weather report?

choices.text: Yes, the announcement was delayed.
I’m not sure whether it’s hers.
The forecast is for clear sunny skies.

explanation: Question météo. La réponse (C) donne les prévisions. (B) piège phonétique 'Weather'/'Whether'.

question_text: Can you tell me how long it will take to transfer the funds to my account?

choices.text: Yes, I’ve taken that into account.
You should be credited within the next three days.
It only takes 15 minutes by subway.

explanation: Question de délai bancaire. La réponse (B) répond avec le bon vocabulaire ('credited'). (A) jeu de mot sur 'account'.

question_text: Would you be interested in joining our fitness group?

choices.text: Thank you for asking, but I already have a membership at the gym.
Could you get me a larger size? This one doesn’t fit.
Yes, we can open a joint account.

explanation: Invitation. La réponse (A) est un refus poli justifié. (C) joue sur 'joining'/'joint'.

question_text: What do you think I should wear to the party?

choices.text: A suit and tie.
A nice gift.
On Main Street.

explanation: Conseil vestimentaire. La réponse (A) propose une tenue.

question_text: What is the fine for overdue books?

choices.text: You can borrow videos too.
Yes, it’s an excellent book.
It’s 10 cents a day.

explanation: Coût d'une amende. La réponse (C) donne le prix.

question_text: Did you hear about Rosa's sister?

choices.text: I think the airplane is late.
It's almost 5:30.
Is she all right?

explanation: Annonce implicite d'une nouvelle. La réponse (C) demande des précisions sur l'état de la personne.

question_text: You want me to retype this document, don't you?

choices.text: That type would be best.
I would appreciate it.
I can't document that.

explanation: Demande de confirmation de tâche. La réponse (B) confirme poliment.

question_text: What is the difference between an alligator and a crocodile?

choices.text: My sister is allergic to bee stings.
I'm afraid of spiders.
One has a sharper nose and greyer skin.

explanation: Question de différence physique. La réponse (C) donne des détails comparatifs. (A) piège phonétique 'Alligator'/'Allergic'.

question_text: How soon can you repair my watch?

choices.text: It will be ready next week.
I will turn off the television.
Almost two hours ago.

explanation: Question de délai futur ('How soon'). La réponse (A) répond par 'next week'. (B) joue sur le double sens de 'watch'.
